---
title: "Data Visualization 1"
author: "Isabella Nicastro"
date: "2024-02-21"
categories: [ggplot, code, analysis]
---




Question 1 homework #1 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ncdc_temp <- read_csv('https://bcdanl.github.io/data/ncdc_temp_cleaned.csv')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 1464 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (4): station_id, month, flag, location
dbl  (2): day, temperature
date (1): date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
date_selected <- c('0000-01-01','0000-04-01','0000-07-01','0000-10-01','0000-12-31')
df <- filter(ncdc_temp, date %in% date_selected)
p <- ggplot(data = ncdc_temp,
            mapping =
              aes( x = date,
                   y = temperature ) )

p + geom_line( aes( color = location ),show.legend = F) +
  geom_point(data = df) +
  labs(x = 'month') + 
  scale_x_date(breaks = as.Date(date_selected),
               date_labels = "%b")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



ggplot is a data visualization tool



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(mpg) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x=class,y=hwy))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Question 2 homework #1

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p_1 <- ggplot(data = ncdc_temp,
            mapping =
              aes(x = temperature,
                  y = month))
p_1 + geom_boxplot(fill = "grey70") +
  labs(x = NULL) +
  coord_flip()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Question 3 Homework #1 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggridges)

p <- ggplot(data = ncdc_temp,
            mapping = 
              aes(x = temperature,
                  y = month))
p + geom_density_ridges(alpha = 0.3, fill = "blue")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Picking joint bandwidth of 3.12
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cars <- mtcars

c<- ggplot(cars, aes(disp, mpg)) +
        geom_point(aes(color = hp))
c + labs(x= "displacement")+ labs(y= "fuel efficiency")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popgrowth_df <- read_csv(
  'https://bcdanl.github.io/data/popgrowth.csv')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 51 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (3): region, division, state
dbl (4): pop2000, pop2010, popgrowth, area

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pg<- ggplot(popgrowth_df, aes(reorder(state, popgrowth), popgrowth, fill = region)) +
        geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
        coord_flip() +
        theme(legend.position = c(0.8, 0.2))

pg + labs(y= "population growth 2000 to 2010")+ labs(x= "reorder state, pop growth")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
male_Aus <- read_csv(
  'https://bcdanl.github.io/data/aus_athletics_male.csv')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 83 Columns: 13
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): sex, sport
dbl (11): rcc, wcc, hc, hg, ferr, bmi, ssf, pcBfat, lbm, height, weight

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ma<- ggplot(male_Aus, aes(x=height, y= pcBfat, group=sport)) +
  geom_point(aes(shape=sport, color= sport)) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = c('red','grey','grey','grey','grey'))

ma + labs(x= "height(cm)")+ labs(y= "% body fat")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
titanic <- read_csv(
  'https://bcdanl.github.io/data/titanic_cleaned.csv')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 756 Columns: 4
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (2): class, sex
dbl (1): age
lgl (1): survived

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# t <- data.frame(v1=rnorm(100),v2=rnorm(100,1,1),v3=rnorm(100,0,2))
# data<- melt(titanic$age)
t_2 <- titanic %>% mutate(sex = 'female')
t_3 <- titanic %>% mutate(sex = 'male')
t4 <- rbind(t_2, t_3)

ggplot( mapping= aes(x=age, y = stat(count) ) )  + geom_density(data = t4, fill = 'grey',color = 'grey') + geom_density(data = titanic, aes(fill=sex)) + facet_wrap(sex~.)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: `stat(count)` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `after_stat(count)` instead.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](homework_1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cows_filtered <- read_csv(
  'https://bcdanl.github.io/data/cows_filtered.csv')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 80 Columns: 3
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (2): age, breed
dbl (1): butterfat

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
t <- data.frame(v1=rnorm(100),v2=rnorm(100,1,1),v3=rnorm(100,0,2))
# data<- melt(cows_filtered$butterfat)
ggplot(cows_filtered, aes(x=butterfat, fill=breed, color = breed)) + geom_density(alpha=0.25) 
```
